questions.question_text: Which antenna type should be used for a site-to-site wireless connection?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the result of this Python code?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The result of the Python code >>> (3 * 5) % 2 is calculated as follows:

Multiplication: ( 3 \times 5 = 15 )
Modulo Operation: ( 15 \mod 2 )
The modulo operation finds the remainder when 15 is divided by 2. Since 15 divided by 2 is 7 with a remainder of 1, the result is:

[ 15 \mod 2 = 1 ]

So, the result is 1.
modulus symbol so answer is 1

The result of the Python code >>> (3 * 5) % 2 is calculated as follows:

Multiplication: ( 3 \times 5 = 15 )
Modulo Operation: ( 15 \mod 2 )
The modulo operation finds the remainder when 15 is divided by 2. Since 15 divided by 2 is 7 with a remainder of 1, the result is:

[ 15 \mod 2 = 1 ]

So, the result is 1.

Selected Answer: A
Even number : the remainder when divided by 2 is 0 .
Odd numbers : the remainder when divided by 2 is 1 .

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Southbound API (RESTCONF/NETCONF/XML) = application
Northbound API (RESTful/JSON) = device

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Adding to chiacche's contrib & other posters:

Southbound API (NETCONF/XML) = application
Northbound API (RESTful/JSON) = device

Selected Answer: B
RESTful APIs -> NB (application)
RESTCONF -> SB (device)

questions.question_text: What is one characteristic of Cisco DNA Center and vManage northbound APIs?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which HTTP request produced the REST API response that was returned by Cisco DNA Center?

discussion.content: Just an observation, many REST API interfaces out there will return the modified item after you use PUT or POST on it so that you can verify your changes. So response body payload only is usually not enough to know what method was used.

I knew it was not A or C, but interesting info for future use for those who don't use it much:

Data Types:

GET supports only string data types. <----- hence everything depicted above is in quotes. 

POST supports various data types including binary.

Selected Answer: B
GET: Retrieve (read-only)
POST: Create
PUT: Update
--
fetch: JavaScript API used to send HTTP requests

Selected Answer: B
Given answer is right.
